javadoc:
A class to hold the information extracted from a 
 resource data directory.
 
 NOTE:
 This class is simply a storage class created for 
 parsing the PE header data structures.
 It does not map back to a PE data data structure.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: address
params.comment: the adjusted address where the resource exists

methods.javadoc:
Returns the adjusted address where the resource exists.
@return the adjusted address where the resource exists
methods.name: getAddress
methods.comment: Returns the adjusted address where the resource exists.

return.comment: the adjusted address where the resource exists

methods.javadoc:
Returns the name of the resource.
@return the name of the resource
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Returns the name of the resource.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the size of the resource.
@return the size of the resource
methods.name: getSize
methods.comment: Returns the size of the resource.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the ID of the resource.
@return the ID of the resource
methods.name: getID
methods.comment: Returns the ID of the resource.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the resource type ID.
 For example, RT_CURSOR, RT_BITMAP, etc.
 Returns -1 if this is a named resource.
methods.name: getTypeID
methods.comment:
Returns the resource type ID.
 For example, RT_CURSOR, RT_BITMAP, etc.
 Returns -1 if this is a named resource.

name: ResourceInfo
comment:
A class to hold the information extracted from a 
 resource data directory.
 
 NOTE:
 This class is simply a storage class created for 
 parsing the PE header data structures.
 It does not map back to a PE data data structure.
